title: Textile, 1900–69
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: tied resist patterning in warp (ikat) on plain weave with continuous supplementary warp patterning
description: Long narrow strip of fabric divided into three (warp) stripes, each patterned by ikat in ivory, rust-red, and black with geometric shapes--sections form an all-over diamond pattern. The three stripes are separated from each other by a narrow blue and ivory stripe patterned by a repeat of small hooks.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1900–69.Medium: cotton
Technique: tied resist patterning in warp (ikat) on plain weave with continuous supplementary warp patterning. 1969-170-3.
